introduction.title: Welcome to the EIRA interactive map!
introduction.body: This platform provides an interactive interface to view maps and information developed by PL-LCH (Platform of Hydraulic Constructions) and PERL (Plant Ecology Research Laboratory) at EPFL in collaboration with the Région de Nouakchott and the CNRE (Centre National de la Ressource en Eau) in Nouakchott, Mauritania. Currently, this map provides information related to topography and groundwater level (piezometric) data in Nouakchott city, the study area.

description.title: Project Information
description.body: Despite a warm and dry climate, the city of Nouakchott (Mauritania) has been facing constant flooding for almost a decade, making part of the city inhabitable and posing long-term health and socio-economic threats. During the rainy season (July-September), the combination of a rising groundwater table, artificial groundwater recharge throughout the city, and reduced infiltration caused by rapid urbanization seem to be the origin of the observed increasing frequency and duration of flooding events. This project hypothesizes that increasing the long-term resilience to urban flooding in the city of Nouakchott can be achieved by planting salt-tolerant trees to lower the groundwater table. The project aims to quantify the water uptake of local tree species (transpiration) to simulate scenarios for an integrated and sustainable afforestation strategy for Nouakchott.

navigation.title: Site Navigation
navigation.body: After selecting which month(s) are of interest, the average monthly data layers can be selected using the dropdown menu titled “Select Layer.” The static layers on the left side of the map can also be turned on or off. The descriptions and legend provide additional information for each layer. The navigational tools on the top right part of the map provide the ability to zoom in and out, to see the map in full screen, and to locate the user (if location sharing is enabled). We advise users to access the site on a computer because it has not been optimized for mobile phones.

layers.cityLimit-subtitle: Approximate limit of the dense urban areas of Nouakchott, estimated in early 2023.
layers.piezoContour-subtitle: Based on the manual groundwater depth measurements in the Nouakchott observation well network, these data estimate the average monthly groundwater levels in the study area (in meters above sea level). The monthly values were calculated by averaging the available groundwater level data for each month over the period of record. As such, these values represent a “steady state” monthly approximation of groundwater levels. They are presented here with a 0.25 m-vertical resolution contours.
layers.piezoElevRaster-subtitle: Based on the manual groundwater depth measurements in the Nouakchott observation well network, these data estimate the average monthly groundwater levels in the study area (in meters above sea level). The monthly values were calculated by averaging the available groundwater level data for each month over the period of record. As such, these values represent a “steady state” monthly approximation of groundwater levels.
layers.piezoLocations-subtitle: Locations of the piezometers (observation wells) for Nouakchott groundwater monitoring (CNRE) The data collection period is March 2015 to present.
layers.ponding-subtitle: This layer represents steady-state monthly estimations of ponded areas, meaning that the groundwater head reaches the surface topography at these locations. These monthly ponded areas were calculated by comparing the groundwater level surfaces (represented in the “Groundwater Head (Surface)” layer) to the topographic data provided by the Region of Nouakchott (represented in the “Topographic Contours” layer). The different shades of blue represent different depths of ponding (lighter blue colors mean shallower ponded areas).
layers.topography-subtitle: 1-meter topographic contours of the project area, provided by the Region of Nouakchott.
